So the missing condition is (val[i] % 2) != (val[i+2] %2). If any such i exists where the parity is different between val[i] and val[i+2], then it's impossible, and the answer is NO.

Yes. So the code's missing line is:

if ((val[i] % 2) != (val[i+2] % 2)) flag = false;

So, the code checks for all consecutive elements of the same parity (odd or even indices) whether they have the same parity. If any pair doesn't, then the answer is no.

So the missing code in the for loop is:

if (val[i] % 2 != val[i+2] % 2) flag = false;

Which would be written as:

if( (val[i]%2) != (val[i+2]%2) ) flag = false;

That's the condition that must be checked for each i in the loop.
